name: Hotel France Albion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I returned yesterday (23 April 2007) from our annual trip to Paris. We stayed at the Hotel France Albion for a second time. Again, we were not disappointed. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful and the room, albeit small, was spotlessly clean and pleasant. The day prior to our departure I required access to the internet to check in on line with Air France. The receptionist advised that the cost was 7 euro for 30 minutes or 10 euro for 1 hour. We explained we would only take approximately 5 or 10 minutes and were provided with free access. The weather during our visit was extremely hot for April. It reached 26 degrees each day which to us living in Manchester, England, was an absolute joy.
reviews.title: Hotel France Albion - Excellent Little Hotel

likes.disliked: — Lack of wardrobe/storage space in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is superb and if you use a hotel as we do the France Albion is perfect. All we require is a place to store our belongings (each room contains a safe) and to shower and sleep. If you want luxury then you would need to pay substantially more as we did one year staying at the Hotel Jolly Lotti near to the Louvre, however, we still only used the hotel as a base and feel that the additional cost of a hotel is better used as spending money.
reviews.title: Great Deal!

likes.liked: — Value - it had everything needed for a GREAT price
likes.disliked: — Thin doors between bedroom and hallway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would also mention that we ate at the Ciel de Paris on the 56th floor of the Tour Montparnasse one evening. The views are breathtaking, the service was excellent and the food was pretty good (compared with Altitude 95). The meal for 2 cost 230 euro but that included a bottle of champagne and although some may consider this to be expensive it is still cheaper than a Bateaux tour along the Seine.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recommended the France Albion to another TA member "Kiwigirl" and would be very interested to know whether she actually stayed at the hotel and, if so, what her thoughts were.
reviews.title: Positive experince

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was worried about finding a good hotel when trying to schedule our honeymoon. I looked for two months and narrowed it down to a couple hotels, finally booking a week at the Hotel France Albion. We needn't have worried as our stay was comfortable and we'd definitely return and have recommended the hotel to anyone we hear of talking about planning a trip to Paris!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

likes.liked: — Price, Cleanliness of rooms and hotel, and Friendliness of Staff
likes.disliked: — Space of rooms and broken safe deposit box that was never fixed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As one reviewer wrote, this is a 2* hotel but this certainly isn’t a bad point. The hotel is in a quiet location and yes it is off a side street, but all the streets are side streets which adds to the charm of Paris as a whole. As for ‘no frills’, well for a 2* hotel you don’t expect too much but it had everything you needed - the room was clean, fresh and tidy. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was lovely with a really good hot shower and bath. As for ‘no charm’, again maybe they were expecting too much but the hotel building itself is a classic French building and we overlooked the street from the 5th floor so overlooked more classic amazing apartments.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

likes.disliked: — ....no tea/coffee making facilities (really wasn't anything I would complain about)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn’t have breakfast there because it wasn’t cheap, but mainly because there are too many patisseries and café’s to go to instead. Because we spent so much time exploring Paris, we only really met the staff on reception, but they were very nice and helpful. The French really appreciate (and almost expect) you to speak their language, however, the hotel staff were more than happy to help us along with our appalling pronunciation and our shameful lack of knowledge of the French language!!
reviews.title: Most excellent

likes.disliked: — Breakfast was a bit dear and put us off trying it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: More than anything, this hotel is in a perfect location; it’s about a 10 minute walk to Sacre Coeur/Moulin Rouge area, 2 mins to St George metro station and no more than 5 minutes walk from Rue de Rivoli (excellent for café’s, bistro’s and restaurants) which is the start of all the main attractions.
reviews.title: A most enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel if you want an excellent base for sightseeing in Paris, but if you want something more upmarket then this isn’t the hotel for you. I give it 4 out of 5 and would go back.
reviews.title: Good safe location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, you must go to Chez Flottes, on Rue Cambon, just off Rue de Rivoli – excellent food/atmosphere/wine…the best French onion soup!!
reviews.title: Perfect

likes.liked: — Bright clearn room in accessable location
likes.disliked: — Front desk attempted to be helpful, but I learned more from the tour books

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in the Hotel France Albion for 5 nights in a room-only basis, so I can't speak for the continental breakfast, but we found the hotel to be clean and the linen/towels/toiletries etc all to be perfectly acceptable, especially considering the price we paid for the rooms.
reviews.title: A clean, reasonably priced hotel, not for the claustrophobic though

likes.liked: — Clean rooms, friendly staff, complementary travel cot for infant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They also provided us with a travel cot for our infant child, but with this in the room in conjunction with our suitcases, navigating the room became a bit of an obstacle course. The rooms are very small, I'm not sure if all Parisian hotels suffer from this due to the nature of the overpopulated city, but it was very cramped indeed.
reviews.title: good hotel but not mutch good if they give your room to someone else

likes.liked: — the hotel was clean and good for a 2 star
likes.disliked: — that the did not honour thje booking we had arranged and comfirmed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite this, we had a very pleasant stay, no real issues with noise or anything - although be aware that when exiting the hotel and turning left, when you pass the St-Georges metro stop you're more or less in red-light territory. We passed through it once or twice without any incident, so don't be worried, but just in case that would influence your decision at all.
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel, GREAT service
Well above average 2 star!
reviews.text: We arrived in france and found our hotel without too mutch difficulty .On arrival at reception were told that our room had been let to a group staying at the hotell that wanted to stay in the one hotell together. We told the receptionist that that wasn't good enough as we had recieved confirmation by email. We were told that there was a mix up with the bookings and she recomended us to take a room at the Modial Hotel a few doors away, the room was small and badly in need of modernisation and depressing to say the least, we were then moved to a larger room after our protests we stayed two days and then at last were roomed in the France Albion for the last two days of our stay in Paris.

likes.disliked: — No kettle to boil water for tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the France Albion recently (June 2007) for 4 nights in a Superior Double Room (€ 115/night) and we loved it. The hotel and the room were very clean and the service was remarkable. We were very
reviews.title: Good price and location near Montmartre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom had the usual basic amenities (bathrobes were a nice touch), a window which makes it nice and bright, and a shower/tub. Even in 4-star hotels you may find a dirty or slightly moldy shower curtain, but I don't think you ever will in this hotel. There was hot water all the time and good water pressure.
reviews.title: Great location!
Good convenient and clean base for short Paris break
reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 night break with my adult son booked through Eurostar.

reviews.title: Very pleasant stay ...
reviews.text: As previous reviewers have stated the hotel is very clean and comfortable. We walked form Gare Du Nord - an easy slightly downhill 15 minute walk.

reviews.title: Unexpectedly good 2* hotel in central Paris
reviews.text: Most of the main tourist sites and shops are within walking distance but the Metro is handy for when the feet are tired!

reviews.title: Lovely room in a good location
reviews.text: We stayed on the top floor (room 61). No bath but good shower.

reviews.title: V small, but clean
reviews.text: We didn't partake of the breakfast to cut costs. Took a travel kettle (first timers beware - no kettles in rooms) and purchased fruit and croissants from Carrefour opposite the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really good location, very friendly staff. Thankfully for us, all staff understood English and were extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Would not hesitate to book this hotel again.
reviews.title: Lovely friendly hotel off the beaten path

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had stayed in this hotel 5 years ago and thought it was pretty good then. If anything, this stay was better. The Hotel France Albion is located in the 9th Arrondissement so it's not wildly fashionable (thank goodness!). But it is a very good, very unpretentious hotel that offers a great location between a couple of metro lines (St Georges, Notre Dame de Lorette, etc) so you can get around Paris easily. There is a supermarket across the street and good restaurants within a 5 minute walk - we tried 3 of them and had 3 terrific meals. The hotel staff are fantastic - very helpful and friendly. I was with 2 other girlfriends who had not stayed there and they were also delighed with their rooms....especially the climate control as we were there in a Paris heatwave. I will definitely be going back to this hotel!
reviews.title: hotel provides good value for money with friendly helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: well located with two metro stationsat either end of street. moulin rouge within easy walking distance.breakfast was adequate -just what you'd expect with fruit /fresh bread and cooked bacon,ham,eggs-good selection to cover all tastes.room small which is quite common in paris.only downside was no mirror in the bedroom but adequate mirror/lighting in bathroom.
reviews.title: Will definitely stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Just as all the reviews suggested, a great hotel for the price and very friendly reception staff that spoke English so it not too stressful landing there that you needed to be fluent in French. The room was standard, just noisy as it was facing the street. But what more do you need a clean and comfortable bed, a clean washroom, yes a shower curtain would have helped. But all in all we would definitely visit again. We took a Metro pass and found using the metro very easy and enjoyable after a few starting glitches but being close to the Metro and getting advice from reception was great. The area was very safe too - the first night we walked back from Moulin Rouge at 2 am...didnt feel threatened or unsafe at all. The shuttle was a big help too.
reviews.title: Good little 2 stars hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was fairly large for what I expected, although I did have trouble figuring out exactly how to get the toilet to flush properly on the first try (I'd only once before had such trouble with a European toilet!). But my husband said he didn't have such problems... I must have had bad luck. ;)
reviews.title: 7 euros for half an hour internet!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in October and were very happy with our choice. The staff was great, especially Dominic at the front desk. He arranged for a private car for us and got us a great driver at a great price during the transportation strikes. Our room was a bit small but with a little time we spent there it was just fine. My only complaint is no free internet access, but all in all that is minor. The location is great and very close to the metro.
reviews.title: Great Budget Hotel In Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in October 2010. Considering the price, my expectations weren't too high but I was hopeful. I was NOT disappointed! It may seem to be a bit far from the center of Paris with the Arc de Triomphe, Louvre, etc, but it's very close to 2 Metro stations, and when you're in Paris, if you're close to the Metro, you're close to everything! It has everything you need right across the street, with a small grocery store that sells anything you could possibly need or want and stays open until 11pm as well as a laundrymat just down the street that's open until 10pm. There are plenty of restaurants/cares around too. The room and bathroom were super clean and cleaned daily with fresh towels. There's an elevator that's hardly ever busy since the hotel's not that big. The people at hte front desk were helpful and friendly. You can access the hotel 24hrs/day, there's no lockdown time. The only thing that I found disappointing was the Wi-Fi access was not free. It was 6 euro/day, so we only bought it for one day in the middle of the trip to keep family posted on our whereabouts. Otherwise, I would totally recommend it. We were close enough to walk home from Moulin Rouge, which was awesome since the Metro was no longer running at that time and the odds of getting a cab in front of the theatre at the end of a show is nearly impossible. Also close to trendy Montmartre neighborhood, which is a great place to check out. For the price, considering it's Paris, I would totally recommend it!
reviews.title: A good price for Paris!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not a bad Budget Hotel in a reasonable location. Half an hour to Lourve by foot, 30 minutes to Sacre Coeur by foot. Staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean but very small. Before you say that it is Europe we have been travelling for 5 weeks and this was by far the smallest room. The room was serviced each day, so kept clean. Didn't eat breakfast there so can't comment. Hotel was quiet. As said not a bad hotel, think could find better for same money.
reviews.title: Budget Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: English speaking staff is of high importance in Paris which everybody prefer to speak French, even if they know English! There are very nice staff at France Albion Hotel, Mr. Damiar to name a few. He was very kind to me. Beside the staff, hotel was clean and close to shopping centers and some must-to-see places.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: To describe it in a nutshell, I have to say that I enjoyed staying there and will choose there next time visiting Paris.
reviews.title: Good Budget Hotel and Courteous Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I and my boyfriend went through Europe and Paris was our third stop. When we came to the hotel the staff helped out very much. Excellent speaking guy, that helped us with tips about restaurants, nightlife etc. It was close to the subway and a very nice neighborhood. In the morning you could just go around the corner and buy yourself a new baked croissant. They also had a bigger grocery store close by, as well as restaurants. The rooms were not that big, but they were fresh. TV, a desk and a smaller wardrobe (with safety) was also in the room. Nice bathroom with a bathtub. We were very pleased with our stay, and if we go back to Paris we would stay at this hotel again. You get a lot for your money. And that’s good, because in Paris, everything’s expensive :)
reviews.title: Great hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reviewed this hotel when we stayed there while in Paris to see the Tour De France. We had no hesitation in booking it again when we had a few days in Paris to see Supertramp. Friendly,helpful and English speaking staff. Close to the Metro and some of the main attractions. Happy to return and will do again. It would be nice if it had free internet but there are several cafes nearby that have to get by with.
reviews.title: That good we returned and will again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was ok, really small , but clean.. Quality of sleep very good, no noise on hotel or in the neighborhood. Price a little expensive in my opinion, from what it offers. Guest service nice .
reviews.title: good hotel, good location. Small room and no breakfast for the price paid..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What a wonderful find this hotel was at the end of a long and sometimes arduous trip through Morocco ending in Paris. An easy metro ride and walk to the hotel although airport pick-up is offered. Lovely location, excellent price for the quality offered. Staff (we met four different people) were unfailingly polite and very helpful in English, (my French is very limited). They gave us good recommendations for food, sites etc. I can't say enough good things about this place. I will definitely go back to Paris and will hope to stay here. Thanks for the super time.
reviews.title: Absolutey wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent 2 mid-week nights here with my husband in October. The staff was great - they knew english and were extremely helpful whenever we had questions on directions (which was frequently!) We stayed here during the strikes and they helped us book a private car to take us to and from the airport. It was a little pricey, but it was worth it.
reviews.title: Decent hotel for a Decent price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This quaint hotel provided a wonderful place to stay on my recent girls trip through Europe. The hotel is reasonably priced, the staff is wonderful and accomodating, the rooms are clean, decently sized and the bathrooms were great. (The water pressure is crazy!)
reviews.title: Stay Here!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again, as the location worked as a good base for sightseeing. You can walk to L'Opera, Galleries Lafayette, St. George and more. If you're interested, the sightseeing bus picks up at L'Opera as well.
reviews.title: Very Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definitely return!
reviews.title: Fabulous Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well situated hotel just up from Opera area ( 10 min walk ) nearest metro is St Georges about a 3 min walk. Area is a safe and middle class one and there are plenty of places to eat and good local food shops in the area, selling fresh bread, meat, fruit etc.
reviews.title: A most enjoyable stay !

likes.disliked: — The doors are penetrable to sound from the hallway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: booked hotel because of reviews on trip advisor.I was not disappointed .Friendly engish speaking reception staff,very clean small rooms,cleaned every day,towels replaced everyday, free electronic room safe.Did not try breakfast as not a breakfast person.Good air con in rooms essential as road outside noisy.Only fifteen mins walk fron gare de nord.2 mins to notre dame de llorette metro station.Would use again ( i am planning to do so next year)
reviews.title: fantastic little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is fairly centrally located, close to a metro station and not too far from Gare du Nord. The rooms are basic yet kept very clean. For the price you cannot expect anything better in central Paris.
reviews.title: Average Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: We booked through Venere and when we arrived our rooms were not the ones we expected, they were sufficient though.
reviews.title: Basic but habitable

likes.liked: — Clean rooms, double glazed windows, supermarket across the street, air con, TV
likes.disliked: — Elevator breaking down, garish decor, broken furniture

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Internet is 7 euro for half an hour, which is not really what you want to pay just to do online check in!
reviews.title: good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed 11 nights (yep thats right 11) at this hotel and I'd have to say it was rather pleasant. Its true that the accommodation is very spartan, slightly cramped (it's inner Paris after all) and the decor style resembles that of a motel but the basic amenities of a Parisian hotel are there; air condition, TV (BBC News was the only English channel though), double glazed windows (I had street facing room), toilet & shower, safe and a firm bed.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location, good value

likes.disliked: — Out of date decor, but what you expect for price so....

description: Small and nice, new superior 2 starred hotel, in the 9th arrondissement of Paris, near Opera, Madeleine and direct to Concorde and Musee d'Orsay. Very well situated for business and leisure. Modern equipment with wireless internet connection. very cosy decoration in blue and yellow harmony. An ancient cellar, dating the begining of the century, with old stones. Very copious buffet breakfast will give you dynamism for all day long.
